description: Schema defining how code samples, tool findings, and AI feedback are structured for training and inference in the AI Code Review Assistant.

input.code: string - source code snippet to analyze

tool_findings.tool: string - name of the static analysis tool (e.g., flake8, pylint, mypy)
tool_findings.line: integer (optional) - line number in the code where the issue occurs
tool_findings.severity: string (optional) - level of issue, e.g., info | warning | error

output.expected_feedback: string - constructive feedback or recommendation generated by the AI model
output.confidence_score: float (optional) - model's confidence in its recommendation, range 0.0 - 1.0
output.severity_rating: string (optional) - AI-assigned severity level, e.g., low | medium | high

example.code: def add(x, y): return x + y
example.expected_feedback: Add a short docstring explaining the function purpose.
